reviews.review_msg:
The Good:
- Responsive over email and office hours
- Knowledgeable in the field

The Bad:
- Exams are worth 55% when the course is almost predominantly cookbook-style labs, so exams are the first time you apply your knowledge
- Frustrating marking in labs
The class itself was okay, there were only 4 things that were graded. TA's marked unfairly. reach out to the prof for help she was accessible and understanding.

The lab is totally runned by TA Ashley this semester. lab guidance is always confusing and not detailed enough to make sense. (Especially the Discover QGIS book) Some important scoring points are not labeled in the assignment introduction, if you explain scoring points in lab then the same you should write them in canvas.

Rubric was little to no explanation and SUBJECTIVE. Prof would take off marks for reasons not stated in outline. Questions met with I cant give you the answer. Even if answers were pulled straight from lecture materials, marks taken off for unknown unanswered reasons. Talks about nothing for 90% of lectures then one sentence that will impact grade.

Never before in my life have I experienced rubrics as vague as the ones in 355. On multiple occasions, I got lab questions marked wrong, with the only feedback being "almost" (??). I'm not sure how I can possibly do better/actually learn with that little feedback or a solid rubric to work off. 

Don't take this class.

Brutal professor. midterm average was a C and she decided to make the final the same format. Labs and assignments were graded by the TA and she marked us like we were professional cartographers. Long lectures of useless material with unrealistic standards. Avoid this class at all costs if you can.

Unfair marker, not structured in her grading. Condescending. She said she wants to know that we understood in our answers, but she should be marking on our answers, not on whether or not we could convince her of our understanding. She can't possibly know that, and we couldn't possibly get that across the way she was expecting us to. Avoid her.

This professor marked so hard and did not provide any feedback with any assignments. Do not take this class thinking it is a GPA booster because it is a lot of work. There were so many different assignments and a huge final worth 35 percent that was ridiculous and hard -also closed book. The lectures were also so long and kind of hard to understand

Took this class as a first-year student and would not recommend it. this professor is a GPA killer as she has the harshest marking I have ever seen! I got marks taken off for not being sincere enough on an assignment. also, the lectures are very boring and the final all we were told is to review all of our notes.

Through all my years at SFU so far this is the worst prof I have ever had. She does not want her students to succeed in this course and claims to get above a B it has to have 0 flaws. The content is not what you would expect from a geography course. Do not take this course if you don't need it, it will lower your GPA.

She is the worst professor I have dealt with at SFU. She was completely unprofessional and did not care if her students succeeded in the course. She did not give any feedback on assignments and she communicated in an extremely condescending tone. Her grading system was unfair and unprofessional. I would not recommend this class to any student.
WORSE GRADER

Has not transitioned to online lectures very well. Most slides are just images with zero context. Labs were the best part of the course only because we had a great TA, Stella. All the midterms had to be regraded because she did not communicate with students or TA the expectations for each question, so midterm average dropped about 10%

Nadine is very knowledgeable and passionate about GIS. Midterm is super easy, I studied the night before but ended up over studying. You need to take notes on what she says in class. Labs are easy but take a long time to do. She is a bit rude to her students compared to all GIS profs and sometimes its hard to understand what she wants you to know.

Im really enjoying lecture with her. Shes very knowledgeable and delivers information really well. The labs coincided for the most part with the lecture. Exams are straightforward but do have information that will not be in the lecture slides. Definitely attend class in order to do well. Textbooks were recommended not required.

I love Nadine. It's clear she has a lot of knowledge on and cares about what shes teaching. But, THE LABS ARE SO HARD. so hard :( The labs are not worth the great class and if I could still drop it I would. Not because of Nadine, but because of the labs.
YOU WILL NEVER KNOW HER WHICH PART SHOULD BE FOCUS IN LECTURE. TOO HARD TO STUDY WITH HER
Nice prof!

It was clear the Prof was intent to not spend too much time on the course. The course was superficial at best. We got most of our guidance from the TAs, who are grad students. I am angry and very disappointed with this course!
This course lacked structure, rigor and focus. I wished I hadn't taken it. Seriously considering to switch to PG from SIS.

The prof and the TA had their favorites. Some project groups were marginalized as a result. If they feel english is not your strong point then your project group is doomed. I did  not like the selection of papers we had to read, they are too health focused and I don't have any interest in health research.

Dissatisfied. The course was different from advertised on the outline. The prof does not have an in-depth GIS knowledge and makes mistakes repeatedly. The TAs were managing the course. A number of us wanted to complain to the Head and Dean but decided against it for politically correct reasons. Will not take any other courses with this prof again.
Regretted taking this course. I paid regular fees and learned nothing I didn't already know from the prior SIS certificate courses. Very disappointed.

She definately expects you do the readings. She's super knowledgable and contrary to what's been said, she's friendly. However, she's kind of intimidating (yikes!) so don't get on her bad side and work your butt off. Difficult but very rewarding course.
No Comments

I liked this prof but could not connect with the teaching style. She took an absolute unapologetic disintrest in the lab portion of the course so the course is hit and miss depending on the quality of the TA. **LOTS** of lab time...expext some 24 hrs days.
No Comments

Brutal prof, but not boring. Enjoyed the honesty; there is no hiding that you, as a student, are a major pain in the rear. Big ego. Unclear teaching style. Disjointed. BS's her way through things. Will fight you to the death. Recommend yielding. Will undoubtedly be a very successful academic.

Nadine Schuurman was one of the most influential teachers of my undergraduate career.  Shes tough, and knows shes smart, but it inspired creativity and objectiveness within me.  I found our philosophical discussions of objects in space (geog 455) very fun
Her marking and her t.a's marking are tough, but she gives a good lecture, interacting with the class and making students think about the theory behind GIS

The worst prof ever.  Boring and extremely condesceding to students...I felt like I was in highschool again and being lectured for skipping out.  Material was very interesting but she ruined it for me.  Horrible coordination with TA on term project.

Nadine is great! She knows her stuff and as an added bonus actually knows how to teach the material.  Highly recommend her as a teacher, but also highly recommend never to take gis-unless it will help you in your career.

She is quite entertaining.  She is more concerned about doing the lectures well then breezing through them from lack of time.  The labs require ALOT of work, but she warns the class in the very first lecture of this.

Have to say that GIS could be taught better. I have quite a few complaints about her teaching style... she wasn't very clear at times about explaining the concepts... didn't seem like she knew what she was talking about. Also, not very personable.
No complaints about her personally.  Her labs are verrrry long. 8-12 hours for 5% and she has pretty high expectations but otherwise very friendly (contrary to other reports) and helpful.

Strict but fair. She does not appreciate average work.  If anything, she expects a bit more from her classes than the minimum required for most undergraduate classes. She is still quite new (PhD 2001?) and needs time to get out of grad school mind.
mean to students, contradictory instructions, does not explain or help with assignments, but is an easy marker.
Horrible prof.  Mean spirited and a little spiteful. Project completely unclear and class was overall very boring.
A difficult course. Lab work can take up to 8 hours worst case scenario. Annoyed with students for not doing the readings. Told the class we were her worst class ever! Rude
she's not helpful. sometimes rude to students. anal. lectures are disorganized.
Not very helpful . Vague instructions for term project.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Good teacher but talks real fast
No Comments
